alert.note: Alert for City of Danville; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 4:08PM EST until January 11 at 11:12AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina, including the following county, Caswell and Virginia, including the following counties and independent cities, Amherst, Appomattox, Bedford, Campbell, Charlotte, City of Danville, City of Lynchburg, Halifax and Pittsylvania. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 408 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lynchburg, Danville, Altavista, Yanceyville, Bethel, Hurt and Chatham. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
